page.title: 03Manor Farm
page.content:
The 620 acres of land are owned by the Duchy of Cornwall. The tenant farmer uses methods of intensive cultivation, spraying crops with fungicides, weed killers and fertilisers in order to increase the yield. The use of tractors and other forms of mechanisation enables him to reduce the cost of labour. Rents are so high that he has to use highly competitive methods in order to meet the costs.
Together with two men he can maintain a herd of 31 cattle and, in addition, raises 160 calves which, after two years, are sold for beef. He grows crops of hay and silage to feed the animals and wheat and barley to sell to the grain merchants.
